dmca.title: [ABUSE] Concern about copyright violation
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

 

Please visit our web site at  <http://www.theplanet.com/legal>
www.theplanet.com/legal.

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


  _____  

From: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
[mailto:abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com] On Behalf Of Karon Thackston
Sent: Tuesday, February 14, 2006 2:23 PM
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Subject: [ABUSE] Concern about copyright violation


Hello,
 
It has been brought to my attention that a new site (at IP  70.87.48.194 )
located on one of your servers is attempting to skirt the issue of copyright
violation with the sale of a new product.  At
http://www.instantarticleghostwriter.com/faq.php their FAQ page boldly
states:
 

 Isn't taking sentences from another writer's work plagiarism (stealing)?
 
According to fair use regulations you can use a single sentence from a
larger work and not be in violation of any copyright laws. This is exactly
what Instant Article Ghostwriter does. And quite frankly, what many human
ghostwriters do.
  

 
That's simply not true.  I'm not sure where they got their information, but
taking even one sentence from a work protected by copyright is a violation
as you can see from these resources:
 
If you want details on copyright protection and violation, you can find such
at http://whatiscopyright.org/ (please be sure to read the sections on
public domain and altering someone else's copy) and at www.loc.gov.  The
gist is this:
 

"What if I take someone else's writings, text, HTML or graphic image and
change it around to suit my needs? I own the "new" version, right? If you
did any of that with the original owner's permission, and according to
his/her terms and conditions than you own the "new" version. If not you may
be committing copyright infringement and/or plagiarism. " --
www.whatiscopyright.org 

I can assure you, I have given no permission for my articles or site content
to be used for the profit of someone else.  I do not know if my content has
been illegally harvested by his system, but if it has, it was done so
without my consent.
 
Also, I doubt seriously that The Mayo Clinic gave permission for their
content to be used.  If you paste this example article
(http://www.instantarticleghostwriter.com/example1.php) into CopyScape.com,
you can see that copy was stolen from The Mayo Clinic site. (Text pasted
below.)
 

With ultrasonic liposuction it is possible to remove fat from difficult
areas such as the upper abdomen, flanks, hip and back. It is also possible
to remove more fat in a redo area. Ultrasonic liposuction is not a
replacement for traditional liposuction but it is an addition. It allows one
to remove more fat from areas in the body where traditional liposuction
finds it difficult to remove fat.

The results of ultrasonic liposuction are the same as traditional
liposuction. 

That's more than 1 sentence.

I respectfully ask that you look into the legality of this site.
 
All the best,
Karon Thackston
